intro: Exacum macranthum, commonly known as the Cape primrose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in shades of pink, red, and white. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, featuring trailing stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are borne in clusters and are known for their long-lasting bloom, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements. Exacum macranthum thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade.
